newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Movement up as MGE falls.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Movement up as MGE falls.

text.p: Spring wheat sales picked up slightly on Friday as farmers started to abandon ideas that spring wheat prices would firm, several cash brokers said.
"We are seeing a pickup in country movement," a Minnesota dealer said. "I think the wheat has gotten cheap enough that the farmer has given up."
Farmers had been reluctant to sell in hopes prices would firm, but hopes were fading fast after another fresh contract low was set Friday.
MGE December wheat closed at $3.85-1/4 cents per bushel on Friday and set a contract low. Prices peaked at $6.34 in May.
A large world wheat crop and persistent talk that U.S. wheat was overvalued compared to other exporters weighed on prices, merchandisers said.
"The producer has finally said he's sick and tired of hanging on to the wheat," a Montana dealer said.
Price per bushel for 14-pct protein dark northern spring, durum and white wheats, in dollars per bushel:
Spring Chg Durum(m) Chg White Chg
Spring Chg HRW 12pct Chg White Chg
